result.execSummary:
All charges against Robert Anthony Hill Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Anthony Hill Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Anthony Hill Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Anthony Hill in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Robert Anthony Hill in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.
Defense Motion to Dismiss due to lack probable cause. State argues. Court GRANTS motion of the defense , Court ordered case dismissed without prejudice.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
